concise_definition: adj. 填满的, 充满的; v. 填满（fill 的过去式和过去分词）

definitions.explanation_en: Containing as much or as many as possible; completely occupied or packed with something.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指容纳了尽可能多的东西；被完全填满或塞满的状态。
definitions.example_en: The stadium was filled with cheering fans.
definitions.example_cn: 体育场里挤满了欢呼的观众。

definitions.explanation_en: Having a particular quality or emotion in abundance; often used metaphorically to describe emotional or sensory states.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某种品质或情感极为丰富；常用于比喻性地描述情绪或感官状态。
definitions.example_en: Her speech was filled with passion and conviction.
definitions.example_cn: 她的演讲充满激情与信念。

definitions.explanation_en: To put or add something into a container or space until it is full or complete.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将某物放入容器或空间中，直至其被填满或完成。
definitions.example_en: They filled the glass with water until it overflowed.
definitions.example_cn: 他们把玻璃杯倒满了水，直到溢出来。

definitions.explanation_en: To occupy or take up a position, role, or duty, especially one that was previously vacant.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指占据、担任或充任某个位置、角色或职责，尤指此前空缺的职位。
definitions.example_en: She was hired to fill the position of marketing director.
definitions.example_cn: 她被聘来担任市场总监一职。

comparison.analysis: “Full” 是一个描述状态的形容词，表示某物已达到容量极限，不强调动作过程。而 “filled” 是动词 fill 的过去分词，既可以作形容词，也隐含了“被填充”的动作过程。例如：The bottle is full（瓶子满了）是状态描述；The bottle was filled with juice（瓶子被装满了果汁）强调动作。
“Packed” 强调物品被紧密、拥挤地塞满，常带有“过度填充”或“密集”的意味，多用于物理空间（如行李箱、车厢）。而 “filled” 更中性，仅表示“被填满”，不强调紧密程度。例如：The suitcase was packed with clothes（行李箱塞满了衣服）比 filled 更显拥挤。
“Saturated” 指物质已达到吸收或容纳的极限，常用于化学、物理或抽象语境（如信息过载），强调不能再容纳更多。而 “filled” 是通用词，适用于任何程度的填充，不一定达到极限。例如：The sponge was saturated with water（海绵吸饱了水）比 filled 更精确地表达了极限状态。
